page.title: 03LANDSCAPE, THEBERTON
page.content: The landscape is flat, the fields at harvest time a golden yellow are large though tree fringed, and it is an area where the sky is as dominant in the landscape as the earth. There are miles and miles flat as an airfield and indeed it was used as such in the last war. Mechanisation has enabled the fields to be so large, and sadly the tree lines show numbers of elms reduced to their skeletons, ravaged by Dutch Elm disease or gaps where dead elms have been removed. Although the area has 25 ponds, 4 quite large, 3 almost mini-lakes, only a few are visible from the roads. There are many footpaths, usually from farm to farm, or farm to village, and those that do not follow this pattern reach a single or dual track road soon to link up with another footpath to a farmhouse or farm.
